bibl.title: Joseph Bowers v. William Cochrane. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle

body.p: Territory of Washington, } ss. County of King

To H.G. Thornton and the keeper of the jail of said King County WHEREAS, at a Justice's Court held at my office, in said county, for the trial of Joseph Bowers for the offense hereinafer stated, the said Joseph Bowers was convited of having on the 1st day of November 1887, in said county, committed assault and battety and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that said Joseph Bowers should pay a fine of One Thousand dollars, and ___ dollars costs, and stand committed 500 days or until the same be paid: and whereas, the said Joseph Bowers has made default in the payment of the same. Therefore, you, the said H.G. Thornton are hereby commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said Joseph Bowers to the said keeper; and you, the said keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said Joseph Bowers into your custody in said jail, and him there keep at hard labor for the space of five hundred days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid, or shall there be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 2d day of November 1887 N Soderberg (Seal) Justice of the Peace. Seattle Precinct King C W.T.
Territory of Washington, vs. Joseph Bowers
